channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CFOs chart a course for crypto in corporate finance
item.description: Despite some concerns, finance chiefs are already making plans to adopt crypto, according to Deloitte.

item.title: The 10 Best Workplaces in Miami
item.description: These honorees from the Inc. Best Workplaces 2025 list are all found in Miami and nearby South Florida cities.

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Are Bad News for U.S. Chocolate Companies
item.description: Chocolate suppliers in Canada and Mexico are likely to benefit from the change, while domestic factories face higher prices.

item.title: UnitedHealth Group didn’t just miss earnings, it did something far worse
item.description: In less than a month, this corporate giant had lost more than half its value.

item.title: I’m a cybersecurity CEO who advises over 9,000 agencies and Sam Altman is wrong that the AI fraud crisis is coming—it’s already here
item.description: We may soon recognize a "Moore's Law"-style principle for AI that I call “Altman’s Law”: every 180 days, AI capabilities double.

item.title: A Nutritionist Says These 5 Dietary Changes Mimic the Effects of Ozempic
item.description: Entrepreneurship raises your risk of obesity, but small changes to your diet can have similar affects to new weight-loss drugs and help you avoid gain...

item.title: Software nearly ate the world. Now builders and designers are taking it back

item.title: Why It’s Comeback Time for Professional Behavior
item.description: Showing up and being engaged still matters — especially for small business owners.

item.title: The Fed’s Powell said the phrase ‘downside risks’ six times in his press conference yesterday—is that bad news for tomorrow’s jobs number?
item.description: The jobs number (nonfarm payrolls, to give its technical name) is due out tomorrow. Expect stocks to react strongly if it comes in weak.

item.title: Generative AI Apps Have Already Raked in Nearly $2 Billion This Year
item.description: Amid 2025’s GenAI gold rush, people are exponentially increasing their use of apps like ChatGPT, Gemini, and DeepSeek.

item.title: Powell didn’t just refuse to deliver a rate cut—he also hinted a raise could have been on the cards
item.description: Powell put a cat among the pigeons by suggesting he was minded to "look through" tariff-induced inflation by not increasing interest rates.
